heading: stamping out history
subheading: as part of the post office's "celebrate the century" program, americans were asked to select themes for stamps commemorating the 1990s. their picks have been tabulated and now stamp collectors in the 22nd century will go to their graves thinking that the titanic sank in the last decade of the 20th century instead of in 1912. along with stamps commemorating cell phones, the web, and sports utility vehicles, there will be a stamp for the blockbuster movie as well. does that strike anyone as a bit odd? remembering the movie rather than the actual event?
author: wired staff
text: as part of the post office's "celebrate the century" program, americans were asked to select themes for stamps commemorating the 1990s. their picks have been tabulated and now stamp collectors in the 22nd century will go to their graves thinking that the  titanic sank in the last decade of the 20th century instead of in 1912. along with stamps commemorating cell phones, the web, and sports utility vehicles, there will be a stamp for the blockbuster movie as well. does that strike anyone as a bit odd? remembering the movie rather than the actual event?
